alert.note: Alert for Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Fairfax; City of Falls Church; Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:32PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES...NORTHWESTERN CHARLES...ARLINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFAX... AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF FAIRFAX...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF FALLS CHURCH AND THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA... At 432 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Newington, or over Springfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Alexandria, Waldorf, Dale City, Annandale, Clinton, Springfield, Fort Washington, Fairfax, Fort Hunt, Groveton, Falls Church, Huntington, Coral Hills, Mantua, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge, National Harbor, Nationals Park and Reagan National Airport. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Fairfax; City of Falls Church; Fairfax; Prince William
